newsitem.title: USA: Nationwide sees $10.6 mln in storm losses.
newsitem.headline: Nationwide sees $10.6 mln in storm losses.

text.p: Nationwide Insurance on Friday said it expected to receive about 2,400 claims for insured policyholder losses totaling $10.6 million from tornadoes that struck Arkansas last weekend and flooding in southern Ohio, Kentucky, and West Virginia.
The company said those were preliminary estimates as flood waters had not receded in some of parts of Ohio, Kentucky, and West Virginia.

Nationwide said it expected to receive 1,300 claims from its Kentucky policyholders for total insured losses of $3.6 million in that state. In southern Ohio, Nationwide expects 800 claims for $3.5 million in insured losses.
In Arkansas, Nationwide expects 100 claims for some $2 million in insured losses from damage caused by tornadoes.
About 200 claims are expected in West Virginia for $1.5 million in losses.
